World Models¶

RobotWorldModel¶

This class is the binding from c++ to python of the RobotWorldModel class. It has less functionalities than PyWorldModel. If you plan to extend the World Model of your agent, you should intherit from PyWorldModel.

class pyroborobo.RobotWorldModel¶
Attributes
alive

bool: State if the robot is alive

fitness

double: Robot’s actual fitness

rotation

double: Robot’s desired rotation speed in degrees.

translation

double: Robot’s desired translation speed in pixels.

Methods

get_ground_sensor_values

tuple(int,int,int): (red, green, blue) from the ground sensor of the robot

reset

PyWorldModel¶

class pyroborobo.PyWorldModel¶
Attributes
maxdistcamera: int

Max distance at which the camera sensors can see

f_sensors: List[int]

sensor indices exactly in front of the robot

fr_sensors: List[int]

sensor indices at the front right of the robot

fl_sensors: List[int]

sensor indices at the front left of the robot

rr_sensors: List[int]

sensor indices at the rear right of the robot

rl_sensors: List[int]

sensor indices at the rear left of the robot

Methods

get_ground_sensor_values

tuple(int,int,int): (red, green, blue) from the ground sensor of the robot

reset
property alive¶

State if the robot is alive

Type

bool

property camera_angles¶

view of the angles of the sensors target relative to the center of the robots in radian.

0 -> exactly in front. [-π/2, 0] -> to the front right. [-π, -π/2] -> to the rear right. [0, π/2] -> front left, [π/2, π] -> rear left.

Type

numpy.ndarray

property camera_normalized_distance¶

view of the normalized distance of obstacle seen by camera (Slow).

If the distance is 1, no object is seen by the sensor. If the distance is 0, the object is right next to the robot.

Type

numpy.ndarray

property camera_objects_ids¶

view of the object ids in sight of each sensors

The ids are stored as double, as they are in roborobo. casting them in int can be slow.

Type

numpy.ndarray

property camera_pixel_distance¶

view of the distance of obstacle seen by camera in pixel (Fast)

If the value is maxdistcamera, then there is no object in sight for this sensors.

Type

numpy.ndarray

property fitness¶

Robot’s actual fitness

Type

double

get_ground_sensor_values()¶

tuple(int,int,int): (red, green, blue) from the ground sensor of the robot

property rotation¶

Robot’s desired rotation speed in degrees.

Type

double

property translation¶

Robot’s desired translation speed in pixels.
